comment.author: 33040414@N03
comment._content: Tinto Hill is a volcanic plug near the village of Thankerton in South Lanarkshire Scotland. There is a cairn on top of it which is I think three or four thousand years old. There is now a group on Flickr dedicated to Tinto Hill, although at the moment there are only two members, (I'm trying to change that by bringing it to more people attention.) Given that the name of the ship is Scottish could the ship have been built in Scotland. It may even have been commissioned by a local man. (Lanarkshire) It's just under 30 miled away from Glasgow. Sorry I can't help much. Here's the link for the Tinto Hill Group. www.flickr.com/groups/1397476@N22/

comment.author: 33040414@N03
comment._content: Googled ship - Tinto Hill and found an article from an old newspaper from New Zealand. Are you aware that there is a group called "Tinto Hill" Which currently has only two members. The "founder" and Moderator is James B Brown. If you would like to have a look at this group and hopefully join and add any photos you have of Tinto please check the following link. It is the third chapter down. The article is from 1903. www.flickr.com/groups/1397476@N22/
